channel.title: Run.bat file
channel.description: I'm a mac os x and don't know how to get the run.bat file to work i've looked up many guides but I still cant seem to get it working can someone hop on team viewer and get it working for me?.

item.title: Run.bat file
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I linked you a trial for a windows emulator. You could of course download windows but it costs however windows emulators try and simulate windows and don’t always work so installing windows and disk partioning it would be best;p.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat file
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“EazY, post:20, topic:436949”][quote author=whackatre link=topic=539663.msg3950385#msg3950385 date=1332230568]

Text editor, anything with words that you can read and writer with…
Do the editing he said, then run it via your exitcutible thingy he said as its your equivalent to a command prompt.

man like I said I am terrible with java i don’t know what a “run via exitcutible thingy is or a equivalent to a command prompt is” lmao.

None of what i have said has to do with JAVA, its all simple tech/OS stuff. If you cant do this, you shouldn’t be running a server. Google what i said, and try to do it the best you can.

I’m not running a server I’m trying to connect to a runescape classic private server client run.bat can you just hop on team viewer and set up for me lmfao.

This is very frustrating I want to chuck this piece of shit out the window and eventually go buy a windows computer.

You can always install Windows on your Mac.
[/quote]
link please?[/quote]

I used www.google.com, and found some links for you.

Apple Support

How to install Windows on your Mac with Boot Camp

Boot Camp helps you install Microsoft Windows on your Mac. After you install, restart your Mac to switch between macOS and Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat file
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“EazY, post:15, topic:436949”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=539663.msg3950305#msg3950305 date=1332220266]

Text editor, anything with words that you can read and writer with…
Do the editing he said, then run it via your exitcutible thingy he said as its your equivalent to a command prompt.

man like I said I am terrible with java i don’t know what a “run via exitcutible thingy is or a equivalent to a command prompt is” lmao.

None of what i have said has to do with JAVA, its all simple tech/OS stuff. If you cant do this, you shouldn’t be running a server. Google what i said, and try to do it the best you can.
[/quote]
I’m not running a server I’m trying to connect to a runescape classic private server client run.bat can you just hop on team viewer and set up for me lmfao.

This is very frustrating I want to chuck this piece of shit out the window and eventually go by a windows computer. :D[/quote]
I hate to TV people for such simple things. Why not run the RSC webclient?

I made you a step by step guide. If you cant get it to work, i’ll be forever dissapointed.
(this is how i would do it on linux, and its BASH (command-line) editing very close to Mac)

To run the run.bat:
1)open up run.bat in a text editor
2)copy the whole line that begins with the word ‘java’
3)open up a new text document
4)past what you had copied (the java line)
5)save it as run.sh
6)open up a terminal
7)type chmod +x /PATH OF FILE/run.sh (this makes it executable)
8) type ~/run.sh
9)???
10)Success!

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat file
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“EazY, post:8, topic:436949”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=539663.msg3950286#msg3950286 date=1332219193]

take the java command line out of it, make a new file, past it in there, and rename it to run.sh
then make it exeutable, and run it from the command line.

whats a command line? i’m sorry but I am a lost soul with computers honestly x).

The terminal.

[/quote]
i’m guessing you mean when you open the file with “notepad” which you would do on a pc but mac our different so how would i open this? textwrangler?.[/quote]
I use Linux, so its very similar to mac (Kernel/command-line wise).

Any open it up with any text editor

Read full topic
